Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
dodger \dodg"er\, n. 1. One who dodges or evades; one who plays fast and loose, or uses tricky devices. --Smart. [1913 Webster]
2. A small handbill. [U. S.] [1913 Webster]
3. See {Corndodger}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Dodger \Dodg"er\, prop. n. a member of the professional baseball team called the Dodgers. At one time the team was headquartered in Brooklyn, New York, when it was called the Borrooklyn Dodgers, but the franchise was transferred to Los Angeles. [1913 Webster]
dodger n 1: a shifty deceptive person [syn: {fox}, {slyboots}] 2: small oval cake of corn bread baked or fried (chiefly Southern) [syn: {corn dab}, {corn dodger}]
